title: Test
yAxis: Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars, with a total of 12 data points.
Overall Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars has increased over the Year
Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars is roughly constant from 2007 to 2013, gradually increasing from 2013 to 2014, and lastly roughly constant from 2014 to 2018.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2013 and 2014.
Max Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars about 5.01 was recorded at Year 2018
Min Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars about 2.93 was recorded at Year 2008
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars, with a total of 12 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2007 to 2011.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2013 to 2016.
Similarly, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2016 to 2018.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly increasing which exists from 2011 to 2013.
